issue.title: v0.19.0 testing
issue.body:
Link to binaries:
* v0.19.0rc1 : https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.19.0/test.rc1/ (coming soon)

Let us know which version you tested on which operating system.

If you find an issue, please search Github for known issues first and then open a new Github issue. This meta issue should not be used to report bugs, as a single thread makes it impossible to track more than one topic.

See [Release Notes](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/bitcoin-devwiki/wiki/0.19.0-Release-Notes-Draft) for a list of changes, and testing reports for earlier releases ([v0.18.0](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/15555)), for an idea what to test.

events.body:
tACK v0.19.0rc1 on macOS 10.14.6:

* tested installing from (signed) DMG
* tested loading wallets

I'd like to repeat my point that this meta issue should not be used to report bugs, as a single thread makes it impossible to track more than one topic.

I think the OP should mention that

I've tested rc1 (for now, the tag, not the release binaries, will check those too)

- on ARM32 debian 10 (non-pruned)
- on x86_64 Ubuntu 18.04 (in pruned mode), as backend for joinmarket
- on x86_64 FreeBSD (non-pruned), as backend for c-lightning

binaries:

- tested RISC-V binaries on SiFive Unleashed w/ up to date Fedora, `bitcoind` and `bitcoin-cli` work, synced the last part of the chain succesfully

I've tested rc1 release binaries by running `export LC_ALL=C.UTF-8; bin/test_bitcoin`

Edit: After @fanquake 's hint I am adding this `export LC_ALL` according to #14948 

- on i686 Ubuntu 19.04 (with multilib, the same system as x86_64 below) no errors detected
- on x86_64 Ubuntu 19.04 no errors detected
- on ARM32 Ubuntu 19.04 no errors detected, also a pruned node (mainnet and testnet)
- on ARM32 Debian 10 no errors detected
- on ARM64 Debian bullseye/sid no errors detected
I'm also patiently running an IBD on an ARM32 device to get bonus points in #17002. I switched that instance to rc1 and it's still happily chipping away at blocks (497500 and counting...).

> I'm also patiently running an IBD on an ARM32 device to get bonus points in #17002. I switched that instance to rc1 and it's still happily chipping away at blocks (497500 and counting...).

What are review points? Also what does checkpoints = 0 do?
@Relaxo143 please ask in #17002; it's not relevant here.
Tested on Windows10 1709 64-bit, no errors detected.

Tested tagged rc3 built from source on Debian 4.19.37-5+deb10u2 (2019-08-08) x86_64 GNU/Linux.

Ran bitcoind for a day with no issues, normal log, ran various CLI commands. Ran it also with c-lightning v0.7.2.1-414-g68222dd and tested various lightning CLI commands. Blocks synced.
```
~/projects/bitcoin/bitcoin/src ((HEAD detached at v0.19.0rc3))$ bitcoind
2019-10-29T09:46:33Z Bitcoin Core version v0.19.0rc3 (debug build)
```
Ran the GUI, various console commands, and menus. Created wallets and loaded various wallets, created addresses and transactions.

![Screenshot from 2019-10-29 10-59-02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2415484/67757128-1e4ab780-fa33-11e9-8051-8f186b9a8a59.png)
